Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which every dollar spent in the new Obamacare system goes to private-sector insurance companies, as it fails to acknowledge the role of expanded Medicaid in the Affordable Care Act.
Understate: The claim may understate the role of expanded Medicaid in Obamacare, as it only focuses on the insurance marketplaces run by the federal government and individual states.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the assertion that every dollar spent in the new Obamacare system goes to private-sector insurance companies.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists regarding the allocation of funds in the new Obamacare system, as expanded Medicaid also plays a significant role in the Affordable Care Act.
